titleInfo.title: Managed Care and Children's Health: An Analysis of Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnosis, and Treatment Services under State Medicaid Managed Care Contracts

location.physicalLocation: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)

mods.abstract: This report examines the intent to which state Medicaid agencies incorporate the various requirements of the EPSDT (Early and Periodic Screening, Diagnosis, and Treatment) Program into contracts with managed care plans. These contracts are the principle document signifying the plans' service obligations. Because EPSDT encompasses such a broad range of services, this report helps make clear which coverage, service, or administrative requirements remain the responsibility of the state agency and out-of-plan providers and which become the duty of managed care plans.
mods.note: Collaboration between National Health Law Program, George Washington Univ., and Center for Health Policy Research

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Langston Hughes Library (Children's Defense Fund Haley Farm)
